text:
Yes, just follow the instructions. You need to create a custom property. If you want users to be able to pick multiple different topics you create a multiple checkbox property, listing all your topics. The you set up lists to filter out subscribers to each topic with corresponding RSS emails.

Please note: you can’t aggregate different topics into one email – if a user subscribes to 5 different topics they will receive 5 different emails.
Works on my side.
Morning, I’ve got a random issue with HubSpots search results page pulling through and announcement bar text inside the listing description. Has anybody any ideas as to why that would be happening?
My custom coded template is not approving by the HubSpot, What I do?

Might need to hire a developer to help with a major crisis! I was advised (as a novice) to build our new website in my sandbox and now that its done it cant be moved over to our main portal. Any ideas!!???? Apparently it isnt possible to move all the files (menus, css, js, modules, template and pages) between portals
hi, is there a way to put the chat bubble behind the cookie policy banner? I have it on the bottom of my page but right now the bubble is covering up the 'decline all' option. thanks so much!

HubSpot Website Grader told us we didn’t have secure javascript libraries, so we ran Lighthouse to find out what scripts were vulnerable. Lighthouse is telling us its the jQuery, when is the plan to get to get the most recent jQuery version?
You can do it manually

Thank you for your help Stephen but I discovered that getting a single deal doesn't give you all the associations. To get the line item ids, you need to use the associations api and then retrieve an individual line item id. Each individual line item id will hold product id which can be used to get the product info using the products api.
<@U01C1Q1A1QR> - yes, you can do that with z index in your css
Hi Darian, would it be possible to share more? I'm not the developer for the website but will relay the information over to the devteam :slightly_smiling_face:

The HubSpot website grader tells me I have to secure the javascript libraries
How can I fix this when I’m using the HubSpot CMS
Hi everyone, where can I find some video course for developing  HobSpot CMS?

You should be able to copy template files/css/js in the design manager, right click > copy to portal. Or you can set up local dev and pull it all down via the CLI and push it back up to the other portal. Not sure on pages though.
<https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/cos-general/how-do-i-copy-a-blog-email-page-template-from-one-portal-to-another>
<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/cms/guides/getting-started-with-local-development>
<https://app.HubSpot.com/academy>
<@U01BPRUKCUB>
Thanks <@UDHT6N5SM>!
settings > cms > pages > uncheck “Include jQuery”
if you’re site is relying on jQuery be sure to add a newer version back via the Site header HTML with a require_js hubl function
If *font_set: “GOOGLE”;* loads the external google font library, what is the field markup for a locally installed font within the theme settings?
<@UGE69FLSW> I think Google is the only one that exists at the moment.
Thanks <@UDHT6N5SM>
<@UGE69FLSW> Just in case other people see this, I was wrong. You can use custom fonts.
<@UBT0AHWLD> found/shared: <https://HubSpotdev.slack.com/archives/CSFGKSHT7/p1597161436035900>
